subsubsection.title: Vocabulary
subsubsection.p:
Look up the definitions of new terms in the Glossary.
Ordered triple
Gaussian reduction
Triangular form
Back-substitution

li.p: The solution to a 3\times 3 linear system is an ordered triple.
A 3\times 3 system in triangular form can be solved by back-substitution.
Gaussian reduction is a generalized form of the elimination method that can be used to reduce a 3\times 3 linear system to triangular form.
3\times 3 linear systems may be inconsistent or dependent.
How can you check whether an ordered triple (a, b, c) is a solution of a 3\times 3 system?
In order to solve by back-substitution, does the shortest equation in a triangular system have to be at the bottom?
After you have eliminated one variable from two of the equations in a 3\times 3 linear system, what is the next step?
How would you start Gaussian reduction on a 3\times 3 linear system if the first equation has only two variables?
